poem:
**In the Vaults of Data**

In corridors of quiet numbers,  
health's secret hum  
echoes—a vast archive  
of whispered life,  

safely shelved, each breath and pulse  
aligns for the science of tomorrow.  

Here, careful hands uncover  
truth in patient-led dreams,  
the future's promise gently cradled  
in the hum of now.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK Biobank is safely sharing health data to drive medical research | Letter Your report (Revealed: Chinese researchers can access half a million UK GP records, 15 April) fails to recognise the importance of data in advancing health research, when shared safely, securely and on a global scale. UK Biobank was set up 20 years ago by the Medical Research Council and Wellcome with the mission to create the most detailed source of health data". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: UK Biobank is safely sharing health data to drive medical research | Letter Your report (Revealed: Chinese researchers can access half a million UK GP records, 15 April) fails to recognise the importance of data in advancing health research, when shared safely, securely and on a global scale. UK Biobank was set up 20 years ago by the Medical Research Council and Wellcome with the mission to create the most detailed source of health data
